articles.title: NDC of DPRK Clarifies Principled Stand on U.S. Hostile Policy toward It
articles.content:
NDC of DPRK Clarifies Principled Stand on U.S. Hostile Policy toward It
						
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The National Defence Commission of the DPRK Friday released the following statement:
					 Time goes by, bringing changes in the era. 
					
					 It is long since the scars left by the horrible disasters of World War II were no longer visible in various parts of the world.
					
					 However, it is only the Korean peninsula where the tragedy of territorial and national division is going on and military tension and war danger are escalating.
					
					 This is entirely attributable to the U.S. brigandish hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 Bosses of the White House have been replaced many times from the Truman administration which was directly involved in partitioning Korea to the present Obama administration. But the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK remains unchanged. 
					
					 On the contrary, its hostile policy toward the DPRK has been steadily modified and supplemented to be a harsher one.
					
					 Recently, the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK aimed at strangling the latter politically, economically and militarily and Washington's moves pursuant to it  have reached such a grave phase that they can no longer be overlooked.
					
					 Washington has tightened "sanctions" against the DPRK and stepped up the moves to "isolate and blockade" against it and posed undisguised military threat to it over its nuclear deterrence for self-defence. This has only driven the situation on the Korean peninsula to the brink of war.  It is escalating the "human rights" racket against the DPRK by falsifying facts. This racket has also reached an extreme phase, going beyond a danger level.
					
					 Shortly ago, the U.S. Department of State made no scruple of daring accuse the DPRK of its election results, a provocation. It asserted that the election of deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly can not be viewed as a "model of democracy" and it is "skeptical" about the news that 100 percent of the electors voted for the candidates.
					
					 When looking back on history, it is none other than the U.S. which has always recklessly found fault with the DPRK over everything done by its service personnel and people, terming it "provocation" and "threat", and dared wantonly infringe upon its sovereignty, their life and soul. The U.S. is the sworn enemy which has perpetrated wicked and foolish acts to undermine the ideology of the DPRK and bring down its social system.
					
					 As regards the prevailing grave situation, the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK clarifies its principled stand on the U.S. hostile policy toward it at home and abroad as follows, reflecting the unanimous will of its party, state, army and people:
					
					1. The U.S. should make a policy decision to roll back its anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK and lift all the measures pursuant to the policy, before it is too late.
					
					 Its hostile policy toward the DPRK is the harshest one aimed at undermining the ideology of the DPRK and bringing down its social system by dint of U.S.-style democracy and market economy, and swallowing up all Koreans and the whole of Korea by force of arms for aggression.
					
					 In a bid to realize such a politically-motivated sinister scenario, the U.S. has recklessly escalated its moves to slap "sanctions" against the DPRK and "isolate and blockade" it by bringing together all hues of dishonest forces after labeling the DPRK "provocateur" and "dangerous target" according to its unilateral and self-righteous Yankee-style criteria and principle.
					
					 By origin, the U.S. is the chieftain of provocation and aggression. It, at the same time, styles itself an apostle of peace though it is an ill-famed mastermind of war and destruction, groundlessly accusing others.
					
					 Hence, the U.S. has covered up its overseas policy of aggression with such ostentatious veils as "peace", "democracy", "deterrence" and "rapid reaction" and termed its undisguised war moves for aggression "defensive" and "annual" ones.
					
					 Even U.S. Secretary of State Kerry in a recent public appearance slandered the DPRK, branding it as a "country of evils", "evil place" and "closed country", crying out for making "diplomacy work on it through pressure and sanctions" and forcing it to yield to them.
					
					 Worse still, during his junket to Seoul early this month former U.S. President Bush praised some "defectors from north," human scum to be thrown into a dumping ground, as heroes, cynically blustering that the social system in the DPRK should not be allowed to be as it is. Such brigandish behavior of the U.S. may work on other continents and countries, but not on the army and people of DPRK who regard sovereignty as dear as their life.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to lift by itself all unjust measures in all fields before facing the disastrous consequences to be entailed by its anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					2. The U.S. should have a proper viewpoint and stand on the DPRK's nuclear deterrence and stop behaving foolishly, letting loose a string of reckless remarks that the DPRK's "dismantlement of its nukes first" is the "keynote" of the hostile policy towards it.
					
					 As the DPRK has clarified on various occasions, the nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula originated from the U.S. introduction of nukes into south Korea in the 1950s.
					
					 At that time, the U.S. secretly deployed more than 1 000 nuclear warheads and its launching means in various parts of south Korea, arrogantly claiming "neither to confirm nor to deny is the nuclear policy of the U.S."
					
					 Since then, Washington has shipped various types of nuclear strike means into the vicinity of the DPRK's territorial air, waters and land, escalating its nuclear threat and blackmail against the latter.  It thus deliberately laid obstacles in the way of denuclearizing the Korean peninsula.
					
					 This situation compelled the DPRK to have nuclear deterrence for self-defence to defend the sovereignty of the country and nation.
					
					 The DPRK does not hide that the main target of its already-diversified nuclear strike means is the U.S.
					
					 Placing main emphasis on putting an end to the U.S. nuclear threat and blackmail, the service personnel and people of the DPRK will make sustained efforts to realize the denuclearization of the peninsula in the future, too.
					
					 Washington is now persistently letting loose such rigmarole that it does not recognize the nukes of the DPRK and there will be a "dialogue and improvement of relations" between the U.S. and the DPRK only when the DPRK takes an action to dismantle its nukes.
					
					 The U.S. should properly understand that Pyongyang's nuclear deterrence is neither a means for bargaining nor a plaything to be used by it keen on dialogue and blinded by the improvement of the relations.
					
					 Moreover, the DPRK's nuclear deterrence is by no means a ghost-like means which does not exist when it is not recognized by the U.S. or remains when it is "recognized" by it. 
					
					 The U.S. is resorting to what it calls "patience strategy", hoping the DPRK to move and make changes first, but such things desired by  Washington will never happen.
					
					 It is the stand of the DPRK to wait with a high degree of patience for the time when the White House has a person with normal insight and way of thinking as its boss.
					
					 The U.S. should bear in mind that the efforts of the army and people of the DPRK to bolster up its nuclear deterrence for self-defence will go on and additional measures will be taken to demonstrate its might one after another as long as the U.S. nuclear threat and blackmail persist as now.
					
					3. The U.S. should stop at once its groundless "human rights" racket against the DPRK which began as part of its new hostile policy towards the latter.
					
					 One can hardly find in the world such an advantageous social system as the Korean-style socialist system centered on the popular masses which fully guarantees human rights, the fundamental rights of human beings.
					
					 Admittedly, the people of the DPRK are still not as well off as others.
					
					 However, its army and people are not envious of such corrupt and ailing capitalist society as the U.S. where the rich get ever richer and the poor get ever poorer and the law of the jungle and arbitrary and high-handed practices are rampant and human rights are ruthlessly violated.
					
					 They are proud and honored to live in the society full of joy and optimism as they have a far-reaching goal to build a paradise on this land by their own efforts and are working hard to translate it into stirring reality.
					
					 The U.S. quite often accuses the DPRK, even using such words as the "worst tundra of human rights" and "society with poor human rights records."
					
					 What matters is that the U.S. noisy "human rights" racket against the DPRK is nothing but hysteria kicked up by the human scum who fled to south Korea after being forsaken even by their kith and kin for their all sorts of evil doings and vices perpetrated in their hometowns. In other words, it is the charade staged on the basis of the misinformation provided by them. 
					
					 Great irony is that such big country as the U.S. uses those human scum who are more dead than alive for its campaign for hurting the dignity of the DPRK. This must be a tragicomedy of the 21st century orchestrated by Washington.
					
					 National sovereignty is more important than human rights.
					
					 Probably this is the reason why the U.S. keeps more prisoners than any other countries in the world, mercilessly brandishing sharp swords against any forces opposed to the state and endangering its existence. 
					
					 The DPRK also does not show any mercy and leniency towards a tiny handful of hostile elements doing harm to the ideology and social system chosen by all its people who are the masters of the sovereignty.
					
					 This is because they are riff-raffs and dregs of society and good-for-nothings as useless as slag in molten iron in the furnace.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to mind its own business, being aware of where it stands, before talking nonsense about others' affairs.
					
					 The U.S. hackneyed hostile policy toward the DPRK is bound to finally go bust as it fails to properly understand it, turning its face away from the trend of the times. 
					
					 This is the immutable truth taught by history.
					
					 The  more persistently the U.S. pursues its scenario for forcing the DPRK to dismantle its nuclear deterrence with brigandish sophism, the further it ratchets up its campaign to impair the prestige of the dignified DPRK and defame its social system with conspiratorial "human rights" racket and the more deliberately it brings the situation on the peninsula to the brink of war, peddling rumors of "provocation and threats," the more serious self-contradiction it will face and the more gloomier and more miserable its prospect of downhill turn will be.
					
					 The U.S. had better roll back its worn-out hostile policy toward the DPRK as soon as possible and shape a new realistic policy before it is too late. This would be beneficial not only to meeting the U.S. interests but also to ensuring the security of its mainland. 
					
					 The U.S. should judge the situation with a cool head and make a policy decision in line with the trend of the times.
					
					 The army and people in the DPRK advancing dynamically full of conviction in the final victory will never tolerate the U.S. hostile policy but decisively foil it.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Reply Message from Lao President
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Reply Message from Lao President
						
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a reply message from Choummaly Sayasone, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and president of the Lao People's Democratic Republic, on Wednesday.
					 Choummaly Sayasone in the message expressed deep thanks to Kim Jong Un for sending warm congratulations and best wishes to him on his 78th birthday.
					
					 The message expressed the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two parties, governments and peoples would steadily grow strong.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health, happiness and great success in carrying out the noble cause.

articles.title: Shooting Gallery in Pyongyang Tells about Leaders' Love for People
articles.content:
Shooting Gallery in Pyongyang Tells about Leaders' Love for People
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The Meari Shooting Gallery has taken its shape in Chongchun Street here as a public service centre for the popular masses.
					 It is associated with the devoted efforts made by the great Generalissimo Kim Jong Il and supreme leader Kim Jong Un to provide the people with better living conditions.
					
					 The gallery was built in February Juche 85 (1996) under the deep care of Kim Jong Il. He took measures for supply of materials needed to build this comprehensive and modern shooting gallery in a short period and settled all problems arising in its operation, sending scores of video-game apparatuses to it.
					
					 In February 2012, Kim Jong Un visited the gallery, setting the tasks to improve it associated with feats of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He said that its indoor firing range should be renovated for the convenience of spectators. And he added that the shooting targets should be remodeled to move automatically so that shooters can see their marks and that the point of impact and its assessment should be displayed on a computer basis.
					
					 The supreme leader also stressed that outdoor firing range should be bettered and different shapes of targets displayed. He underscored the need for the gallery to improve its management and service and thus contribute to the people's cultural and emotional life.
					
					 Thanks to his energetic guidance, the gallery has turned into a modern service center, flawless in formative artistic representation, too.

articles.title: Art Works Created by Kim Il Sung during Anti-Japanese Struggle
articles.content:
Art Works Created by Kim Il Sung during Anti-Japanese Struggle
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The performance of drama "Blood at an International Conference" is now going on at the National Theatre here. The drama gives an idea that neither the dignity of any nation nor the independence of a country can be won with help or "aid" of big countries.
					 It was written by President Kim Il Sung during the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle.
					
					 In the days of conducting the great war against the Japanese imperialist aggressors, he created revolutionary operas, dramas, songs and many other literary works to show the way for independent life and the truth of struggle.
					
					 Among them are "The Flower Girl", "Sea of Blood", "The Mountain Shrine", "A Letter from a Daughter", "An Jung Gun Shoots Hirobumi Ito" and "Three Pretenders". Those works stress the ideas that revolution and struggle are the only way for the oppressed people to live, independence is what keeps a nation alive, one's own destiny is shaped by oneself, not by God, knowledge is power and factional strife and division ruin a nation. They show the true ways for national liberation and class emancipation.
					
					 There are also such songs as "Anti-Japanese War", "The Korean People's Revolutionary Army" and "The Ten-Point Programme of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland". The songs gave unshakable faith and optimism to the anti-Japanese guerrillas and people, contributing to the victorious conclusion of the anti-Japanese armed struggle led by Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Unity and Cohesion of WPK Are Greatest Heritage Left by Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Unity and Cohesion of WPK Are Greatest Heritage Left by Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il: Rodong Sinmun 
						
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The invincible unity and cohesion of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) are the greatest heritage left by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who devoted all their lives to them and a treasure for the eternal victory of Songun Korea, says Rodong Sinmun Saturday in an article. 
					 The article goes on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il put forward the single-minded unity as the revolutionary philosophy of the WPK and mainstay of the Korean revolution long ago and worked heart and soul to strengthen the unity and cohesion of the party in the whole period of their leadership of the revolution. 
					
					 Since the very day of its foundation the WPK has carried forward the noble tradition of unity and cohesion, demonstrating its might as steel-strong ranks united close around the leader in one thought and one purpose with moral sense of obligation and an invincible party never allowing any alien ideological element. 
					
					 The invincible unity and cohesion of the WPK are becoming firmer and more pure as it is led by Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Thanks to him the WPK will throw its rays as the great party of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for all ages and the history of the WPK which has achieved the unbreakable unity and cohesion will be adorned with the history of the peerlessly great men forever no matter how much water flows under the bridge and no matter how many generations are replaced with new ones.
					
					 The party's unity and cohesion being carried forward through generations are the crystal protecting the leader in which the whole party is firmly united around the headquarters of the revolution, ideological integrity in which the whole party is imbued and consolidated with the idea and intention of the leader and the integral whole of action in which the whole party moves as one under the monolithic leadership of the leader. 
					
					 The invincible unity and cohesion of the WPK, greatest heritage left by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, are the eternal foundation of the Songun revolution and the banner of victory guaranteeing the eternal future of Korea.

articles.title: U.S. and S. Korean Warmongers Stage North-targeted Naval Drills
articles.content:
U.S. and S. Korean Warmongers Stage North-targeted Naval Drills 
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The U.S. aggression forces together with south Korean army staged combined maneuvers as part of Foal Eagle in the East, West and South Seas of Korea on Friday, according to the south Korean KBS. 
					 Warships of the U.S. forces and destroyers, Aegis ships, escort ships, patrol crafts and other type ships of the south Korean Navy took part in the drill for a preemptive attack on the DPRK. 
					
					 The situation prevailing on the Korean peninsula is so tense that a nuclear war may break out owing to the reckless war hysteria of the U.S. imperialists to militarily stifle the DPRK at any cost.

articles.title: Settlement of Issue of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Settlement of Issue of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army Called for in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Members of the Women's Solidarity and other women's organizations and women of different social standings in south Korea held the 1117th Wednesday rally on Mar. 12 to get the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army settled.
					 At the rally speakers said that the actions for settling the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army are being staged worldwide.
					
					 Many Korean women whose chastity was ruthlessly violated by the Japanese imperialists died with grudge unsettled and the surviving victims are still suffering pain but the Japanese government has not yet made any apology, they charged.
					
					 On the contrary, Japan is getting frantic in its moves to justify the sexual slavery, embellish war crimes and revive militarism, they held.
					
					 They declared they would carry on their actions to have the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army settled.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Deceptive Welfare Policy Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Deceptive Welfare Policy Slammed
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Members of a disabled organization, a human rights organization and the Confederation of Trade Unions of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on March 12, according to the south Korean paper Labor and World.
					 At the press conference speakers said that there recently occurred a case in which mother and her daughters committed suicide at Songpha District in Seoul. The authorities are to blame for this as they turned their back on the wretched plight of the suicides driven into the bottom of their life, the speakers added.
					
					 The authorities' deceptive welfare policy brought them to death, they charged.
					
					 They said that they would conduct activities to terminate vicious cycles of poverty and despair and build a society where poor people can lead a worthy life as human beings.

articles.title: Resignation of Conservative Ruling Forces Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Resignation of Conservative Ruling Forces Demanded in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Minjok Ilbo Wednesday issued an editorial calling for resignation of the south Korean conservative ruling forces engrossed in fabricating cases.
					 The editorial said the voices of people from all walks of life in south Korea are loudly ringing out day by day to have the Intelligence Service (IS) dismantled and its director punished.
					
					 It noted:
					
					 The opposition parties said that it is the people's cognition and public opinion that evidence which has been revealed so far is enough to relieve the director of the IS from his office, adding what measures are taken against the IS, chief culprit of the successive fabrication of cases, is a yardstick to judge the present "government".
					
					 The Unified Progressive Party sent a protest letter to the present chief executive, demanding her apologize to the people for IS's cooking up of a spy case and the prosecution's false investigation, dismiss the director of the IS and the minister of Justice and introduce a special investigation system.
					
					 Lawyer Kim Yong Min accused the chief executive, the ruling party and conservative media of making much ado, upset by the disclosure of the truth about the IS's fabrication of a spy case.
					
					 The mounting resentment confirms that the destiny of the present "government" is at stake.

articles.title: 10U.S. Dares Not Invade DPRK: Korean in U.S.
articles.content:
U.S. Dares Not Invade DPRK: Korean in U.S.
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- An article written by the director of the Institute of Independent Ideology in the U.S. was posted on   Minjok Thongsin, an internet newspaper of Koreans in the United States on March 11. It is titled "Why does the U.S. dare not conduct armed invasion of north Korea?"
					 The article accused the U.S. of employing all sorts of means to put countries desirous of independence under its rule as it invaded such countries as Iraq and Afghanistan.
					
					 But Washington dares not invade the DPRK, it said and went on:
					
					 The reason can be explained above all by the fact that President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il ushered in a new era of national independence and provided a firm foundation guaranteeing the country's prosperity and happiness of the generations to come.
					
					 The revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK have fully displayed the might of the powerful revolutionary army under the leadership of the preceding leaders and are now growing to be a powerful army having all-mighty Juche-oriented tactics and experience of all victories and the Korean-style offensive and defensive means capable of successfully fighting any modern war.
					
					 Juche Korea has a hundred-year-long glorious history and the future of the DPRK is in safe hands as the heroic Korean People's Army has an ever-victorious history.
					
					 Another reason why the U.S. dares not provoke the DPRK is that the latter is a society in which the service personnel and people are single-mindedly united around their leader, the article concluded.

articles.title: Korean in Russia Supports Rocket-launching Drills in DPRK
articles.content:
Korean in Russia Supports Rocket-launching Drills in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Ri Chae Son, vice-chairperson of the Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia, on Wednesday made public a statement in denunciation of the U.S. for finding fault with the DPRK over its rocket-launching drills. 
					 The statement said that the U.S. is terming the DPRK's recent rocket-launching drills a "provocation" and "violation of the resolutions of the UN Security Council". 
					
					 It went on:
					
					 As far as the DPRK's rocket-launching drills are concerned, they are the exercise of the independent rights of a sovereign country as they were conducted according to its regular training plans, bringing no damage to the U.S. mainland and neighboring countries.
					
					 It is none other than Washington which made provocations in fact.
					
					 The U.S. terms the rocket-launching drills any country conducts to defend itself on its land a "provocation and threats" and describes Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises, the nuclear war drills targeting the DPRK, by introducing huge armed forces from its mainland as "defensive and annual ones." Such assertions of the U.S. are most shameless and brigandish sophism.
					
					 When the DPRK has taken a series of initiative and magnanimous measures for mending the inter-Korean relations, the U.S. is throwing a wet blanket over the issue of improving the relations. 
					
					 Clear is the U.S. real intention. It is aimed to ignite a war of aggression at any cost. 
					
					 The U.S. is the cruelest country in the world and the country of evils. 
					
					 It should clearly see who its rival is and withdraw from south Korea at once, carrying with its forces for aggression.

articles.title: Organization of Koreans in China Terms U.S. Disturber of Peace and Security
articles.content:
Organization of Koreans in China Terms U.S. Disturber of Peace and Security 
						
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The spokesman for the Zhongnan Regional Association of the General Association of Koreans in China on Wednesday released a statement rapping the U.S. moves for escalating confrontation and war moves against the DPRK. 
					 Recalling that the U.S. found fault with the rocket-launching drills staged by the DPRK according to its regular training plan, the statement went on:
					
					 The U.S. introduced naval striking forces including a nuclear submarine into south Korea, the largest-ever presence. This fact brings into light the aggressive nature of the joint military drills Key Resolve and Foal Eagle being staged by the U.S. and its followers. 
					
					 A group of warships including Aegis guided missile destroyer, missile cruiser and Aegis destroyer with preemptive striking means aboard entered the East, West and South Seas of Korea. 
					
					 The flotilla of warships is going to stage naval combined drills as part of the Foal Eagle joint military drills. 
					
					 This goes to prove that for all accusations and plots the U.S. resorts to falsifying the truth and blaming others, it cannot hide its true colors as a disturber of peace and security on the Korean peninsula and the rest of Northeast Asia. 
					
					 There is no other way for the U.S. but to withdraw all forces from south Korea and opt for concluding a peace treaty with the DPRK.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Benin
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Celebrated in Benin
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the Socialist Party of Benin for celebrating the 102nd birth anniversary of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung was formed in Cotonou, Benin on Mar. 10.
					 Ali Houdou, president of the Socialist Party of Benin, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize colorful political and cultural events to give wide publicity to the exploits of Kim Il Sung on the occasion of the Day of the Sun (his birth anniversary).

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Marked in Poland
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Marked in Poland
						
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- A Polish preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (Day of the Sun) was inaugurated in Warsaw on Mar. 11.
					 Slaboy January Guzowski, chairperson of the Central Committee of the Poland-Korea Association, was elected chairperson of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee discussed the issues to significantly celebrate the Day of the Sun by giving wide publicity to the undying feats of Kim Il Sung and the greatness and vitality of the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Just Cause of WPK and Korean People Supported by Peruvian Personages
articles.content:
Just Cause of WPK and Korean People Supported by Peruvian Personages
						
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Peruvian personages expressed full support to the just cause of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Korean people.
					 Genaro Ledesma Izquieta, chairman of the People's Front of Workers, Peasants and Students of Peru, said at the rally held in Lima City on Mar. 7 to mark the 51st anniversary of the Front and the March 8 International Women's Day:
					
					 The WPK and the Korean people have covered the victorious path in carrying out the socialist cause under the leadership of the prominent leaders.
					
					 The DPRK is a great country with powerful national power.
					
					 It manufactured a satellite and put it into orbit by its own efforts and with its own technique. It is an invincible power with self-defensive capacities capable of protecting the destiny of the country and nation from the enemies' invasion.
					
					 We extend support and solidarity to the WPK and the Korean people in their struggle for protecting socialism against the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 The chairperson of the Peruvian committee for remembering Generalissimo Kim Jong Il said:
					
					 Women in the DPRK have the equal right with men and fulfill their responsibility and role as performers of the revolution and masters of society.
					
					 On the March 8 International Women's Day we deeply recollect the undying exploits of Kang Pan Sok, mother of Korea, and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk who dedicated their all to the women's emancipation movement.
					
					 All women and progressives in the world including Peru will always remember the great feats of Kang Pan Sok and Kim Jong Suk.

articles.title: U.S. Denounced for Fanning Japan's Ambition for Aggression
articles.content:
U.S. Denounced for Fanning Japan's Ambition for Aggression
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea staged the 174th action for independent reunification and peace outside the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Mar. 11, denouncing the U.S. for instigating Japan to exercise the "right to collective self-defense."
					 It condemned Japan for trying to retrogressively revise the Pacifist Constitution and expand the sphere of the "Self-Defense Forces'" activities, not reflecting on its past crimes.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 These moves are being prompted by the U.S.
					
					 The on-going joint military drills are also pursuant to the U.S. attempt to incite Japan to exercise the "right to collective self-defense" and form a triangular military alliance. 
					
					 Japan should never have even a dream of reinvading the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Figures of Beninese Political Party
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Praised by Figures of Beninese Political Party
						
 Pyongyang, March 15 (KCNA) -- Figures of the Socialist Party of Benin lauded exploits of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Ali Houdou, president of the party, said at the inaugural ceremony of the preparatory committee of the Socialist Party of Benin for celebrating the 102nd birth anniversary of Generalissimo Kim Il Sung on March 10:
					
					 Kim Il Sung met heads of state and prominent figures of many countries till the last moments of his life after Korea's liberation.
					
					 Foreigners of all social standings ardently praise him because he was possessed of not only the great idea and leadership ability but also noble traits touching the hearts of all people.
					
					 His benevolent image will be cherished forever in the hearts of progressive mankind.
					
					 The vice-president of the party said:
					
					 After founding the DPRK in 1948, Kim Il Sung wisely led the country and people for decades.
					
					 Under his leadership the DPRK beat back the aggression of the U.S., boasted of being the "strongest" in the world, in the Korean War which broke out when it was less than two years since its foundation, and honorably defended the sovereignty and the dignity of the country.
					
					 The DPRK carried out the rehabilitation and construction and the socialist revolution on the debris of the war and successfully pushed ahead with the socialist construction of several stages.
					
					 We pay high respects to Kim Il Sung, the founder of the DPRK demonstrating its dignity as an invincible power.

articles.title: CDN de RPDC declara posicion en cuanto a politica hostil de EE.UU.
articles.content:
CDN de RPDC declara posicion en cuanto a politica hostil de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 15 de marzo (ACNC) -- En relacion con que en estos dias, la politica hostil y las acciones de Estados Unidos contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se  tornan peligrosas hasta no mas, el Comite de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC hizo publica el dia 14 una declaracion.
					El documento revela que EE.UU. es precisamente el que ha venido pisoteando atrevidamente la soberania de la RPDC considerada como su vida, y el enemigo jurado que actua absurdamente para destruir la idea y el regimen de la RPDC.
					
					En reflejo de la unanime voluntad del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el Estado, el ejercito y el pueblo, el CDN de la RPDC expuso al interior y al exterior la siguiente posicion de principios:
					
					1. Antes de tardar por mas tiempo, EE.UU. debera tomar la decision politica de abandonar su politica hostil anti-RPDC y todas las medidas concernientes.
					
					La politica hostil anti-RPDC de EE.UU. es la mas brutal encaminada a destruir la idea y el regimen de la RPDC con la democracia al estilo norteamericano y la economia de mercado y ocupar con las fuerzas militares agresivas toda la nacion coreana y todo el territorio de Corea.
					
					Antes de afrontarse con las consecuencias catastroficas que se emanen su anacronica politica hostil anti-RPDC, seria mejor que abandone por si mismo todas las medidas injustas. 
					
					2. EE.UU. no debe portarse neciamente chismeando atrevidamente que la "renuncia primero de armas nucleares" es el "principio fundamental" de la politica hostil anti-RPDC al tener un correcto criterio y posicion en cuanto al disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC.
					
					EE.UU. debe saber correctamente que el disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC no es el medio de negocios y regateo a usarse para el dialogo y el mejoramiento de relaciones.
					
					Ademas no es el medio fantasmal que desaparece si el imperio no lo "reconoce" y existe si lo "reconoce".
					
					El imperio estadounidense recurre a la llamada "estrategia de paciencia" deseando que la RPDC se mueva primero y cambie algo, pero tal resultado nunca le tocara a ese pais norteamericano.
					
					Al contrario, la RPDC tiene la posicion de esperar con paciencia hasta que entre en la Casa Blanca el dueno que tenga una normal vision y reflexion realistas.
					
					El imperio debe tener presente que mientras siga aferrandose a la amenaza y el chantaje nuclear, los uniformados y civiles de la RPDC lucharan de continuo por intensificar el disuasivo nuclear autodefensivo y tomaran sucesivamente las medidas adicionales para demostrar su poderio.
					
					3. EE.UU. debera poner de inmediato fin a la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC, iniciada como una parte de nueva politica hostil a esta.
					
					Se dice que sobre DDHH hay el poder estatal.
					
					Por lo tanto, tambien EE.UU. rechaza sin titubeo a las fuerzas que se oponen al Estado y dan peligro a su existencia y tiene mayor numero de encarcelados en el mundo.
					
					Tampoco hacemos caridad ni tolerancia a las minimas fuerzas malsanas que atentan la ideologia y el regimen, optados por si mismo por el pueblo, dueno del poder.
					
					 Seria mejor para EE.UU. limpiar primero su nariz antes de censurar a otros.
					
					Abandonar cuanto antes su vieja politica hostil anti-RPDC y establecer la nueva politica real sera util no solo para intereses nacionales de EE.UU. sino que tambien para la seguridad de su territorio propio.
					
					El imperio norteamericano debe apreciar serenamente la realidad y tomar la decision politica adecuada a la situacion general.
